00056 public:

00077 
00078 template <unsigned D>
00079 bool touch(const Ball<D> &ball1, const Ball<D> &ball2, double dist=0.) {
00080   Vec<D> X = ball1.x;           //  deviation to avoid bickering about 'discarding const qualifiers'
00081   X -= ball2.x;
00082   return (X.norm () <= ball1.r+ball2.r+dist);
00083 }
00084 
00085 
00086 template <unsigned D>
00087   void Ball<D>::DrawBall (const Vec<D> &center, double r,
00088               const Vec<4> &rgba) {
00089   glPushMatrix();
00090   glTranslatef( center[0], center[1], center[2] );
00091   glScalef( r,r,r );
00092   glMaterial( rgba[0], rgba[1], rgba[2], rgba[3]);
00093   //  i have NO idea why, but the line 'if (ball == 0) ball = MakeStone ();'
00094   //  in the c'tor is NOT executed. so i have to do it again here. not pretty,
00095   //  but effective. when i understand the behavior, i will change it.
00096   if (ball == 0) ball = MakeStone (numSegments);
00097   glCallList (ball);
00098   glPopMatrix();
00099 }

00105 template <unsigned D>
00106   void Line (const Vec<D> &x0,
00107        const Vec<D> &x1) {
00108     glBegin( GL_LINES );
00109       glVertex3f(x0[0],x0[1],x0[2]);
00110       glVertex3f(x1[0],x1[1],x1[2]);
00111     glEnd();
00112   }
00113 
00114 //  DrawHypercube (Dimension, vertices[])
00115 //  draws a hypercube with given vertices on the grounds that any hypercube
00116 //  is a cube stretched in an additional dimension; a cube is a square pulled
00117 //  apart, a hypercube a cube pulled apart and so on.
00118 //  DrawHypercube draws the (two) cubes a dimension lower (recursively calling
00119 //  itself), and then finishes with drawing the connecting lines which resulted
00120 //  in pulling the cubes apart along the new dimension.
00121 
00122 template <unsigned D>
00123   void DrawHypercube (int d, Vec<D> x[]) {
00124     if (d > 1) {
00125       unsigned subhypercubesize = 1<<(d-1);
00126       DrawHypercube (d-1, x);
00127       DrawHypercube (d-1, x+subhypercubesize);
00128 
00129       for (unsigned i = 0; i < subhypercubesize; i++)
00130     Line (x[i], x[i+subhypercubesize]);
00131     }
00132     else Line (x[0],x[1]);
00133   }
00134 
00135 
00136 template <unsigned D> Ball<D>::Ball ():
00137   BallBase (), x (), v () {
00138   if (ball == 0) ball = MakeStone ();
00139   for (int i = 0; i < D; i++) {
00140     x[i] = 2.*rnd ()-1.; v[i] = rnd ()-.5;
00141   }
00142 }
00143 
00144 template <unsigned D> void Ball<D>::step (double dt) { x += v*dt; }
00145 
00146 template <unsigned D> void Ball<D>::draw () {
00147   static Vec<4> color (1., 0.5, 0.1, 1.0);
00148   static double distance = 0.;
00149 
00150   if (D > 3) {
00151     Vec<D> xproj;
00152     double projf;
00153     Box<D>::project (D, x, 1., xproj, projf);
00154     DrawBall (xproj, r*projf, color*projf);
00155   }
00156   else {
00157     const double dmax = sqrt (double (D));
00158     DrawBall (x, r*(dmax-distance)/dmax, color);
00159   }
00160 }
